# EpiFilter {#sec-top .unnumbered}


### Description
<div style="font-size:0.8em">Copied from the developer site<br><br></div>

[EpiFilter](package_EpiFilter.qmd#sec-top) estimates the time-varying reproduction number on cases by date of infection using  Bayesian recursive filtering and smoothing to maximise the information extracted from the incidence data used. It takes a forward-backward approach and provides estimates that combine advantages of EpiEstim and the Wallinga-Teunis method. Method is exact (and optimal given a grid over R) and deterministic (produces the same answer on the same data).

EpiFilter is maximally informed, mean square error optimised estimates of reproduction numbers (R) over time.
